Transcription for 1268476

In the father, in the island, in the Spanish seas,
On the tiny white houses and the orange trees,
And beyond my home, the cool and pleasant breeze,
On the Spanish rain will grow green.
There is the red wine and the Spanish hill,
The shallow and arduous, in the ocean's veil,
The sweet, clean, pleasant and the slow, ageless daze,
On the Spanish rain will grow green.
And now, in the distance, the yellow moon,
And in the cozy office, the spirit moon,
And the quiet voice calling in,
The yellow moon, on the Spanish rain will grow green.
